hints.title: Graph Laplacian Converges to Laplace-Beltrami Operator
hints.content:
27: :label: thm-graph-laplacian-convergence
28: 
29: Let $\mathcal{F}_N$ be the Fractal Set generated by $N$ walkers over time $[0, T]$. Let $(\mathcal{X}, g)$ be the emergent Riemannian manifold with metric:
30: 
31: $$
32: g(x) = \mathbb{E}[H(x, S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I]^{-1}
33: $$
34: 
35: time-averaged over the quasi-stationary distribution (QSD).
36: 
37: For any smooth function $\phi \in C^2(\mathcal{X})$, define $f_\phi(e) = \phi(\Phi(e))$ where $\Phi(e)$ is the episode spatial embedding (death position).
38: 
39: Then, for a suitable normalization of the graph Laplacian $\tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N}$, as $N \to \infty$:
40: 
41: $$
42: \tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N} f_\phi \to \Delta_g \phi
43: $$
44: 
45: where the convergence is in $L^2(\mathcal{X}, d\mu)$ and:
46: - $\tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N}$: Normalized Fractal Set graph Laplacian (Definition 3.1.1)
47: - $\Delta_g$: Laplace-Beltrami operator on $(\mathcal{X}, g)$
48: - $d\mu$: Quasi-stationary distribution measure
49: 
50: **Convergence rate**: Under regularity conditions (Assumption 3.2.2),
51: 
52: $$
53: \left\| \tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N} f_\phi - \Delta_g \phi \right\|_{L^2(\mu)} \leq C(\mathcal{X}, g, T) \|\phi\|_{C^2} \cdot N^{-1/4}
54: $$

24: ## 1. Main Convergence Theorem
25: 
26: :::{prf:theorem} Graph Laplacian Converges to Laplace-Beltrami Operator
27: :label: thm-graph-laplacian-convergence
28: 
29: Let $\mathcal{F}_N$ be the Fractal Set generated by $N$ walkers over time $[0, T]$. Let $(\mathcal{X}, g)$ be the emergent Riemannian manifold with metric:
30: 
31: $$
32: g(x) = \mathbb{E}[H(x, S) + \epsilon_\Sigma I]^{-1}
33: $$
34: 
35: time-averaged over the quasi-stationary distribution (QSD).
36: 
37: For any smooth function $\phi \in C^2(\mathcal{X})$, define $f_\phi(e) = \phi(\Phi(e))$ where $\Phi(e)$ is the episode spatial embedding (death position).
38: 
39: Then, for a suitable normalization of the graph Laplacian $\tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N}$, as $N \to \infty$:
40: 
41: $$
42: \tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N} f_\phi \to \Delta_g \phi
43: $$
44: 
45: where the convergence is in $L^2(\mathcal{X}, d\mu)$ and:
46: - $\tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N}$: Normalized Fractal Set graph Laplacian (Definition 3.1.1)
47: - $\Delta_g$: Laplace-Beltrami operator on $(\mathcal{X}, g)$
48: - $d\mu$: Quasi-stationary distribution measure
49: 
50: **Convergence rate**: Under regularity conditions (Assumption 3.2.2),
51: 
52: $$
53: \left\| \tilde{\Delta}_{\mathcal{F}_N} f_\phi - \Delta_g \phi \right\|_{L^2(\mu)} \leq C(\mathcal{X}, g, T) \|\phi\|_{C^2} \cdot N^{-1/4}
54: $$

65: 
66: **Step 3**: Covariance matrix convergence (Lemma {prf:ref}`lem-covariance-convergence`)
67: 
68: **Step 4**: Belkin-Niyogi theorem application (Section 3)
69: 
70: **Step 5**: Connection term from algorithmic dynamics (Section 4)
